immediateSteps: Share your live route with a trusted contact.
Text vehicle number and driver details to someone you trust.
Ask to stop at a busy petrol station or police booth.
Keep your phone unlocked with emergency shortcuts ready.
whatNotToDo: Do not confront the driver aggressively inside the moving vehicle.
Do not switch off your phone or location services.
Do not move to isolated roads if asked to reroute.
recommendedActions: Switch to stealth mode if you feel immediate risk.
Record audio silently for evidence.
Use code word messaging to alert guardians discreetly.

immediateSteps: Stay on well-lit roads and near crowds.
Keep one ear free and stay alert.
Send periodic status updates to your guardian.
whatNotToDo: Do not walk through dark shortcuts.
Do not disclose personal details to strangers.
recommendedActions: Keep flashlight ready.
Use voice trigger monitoring if needed.
Trust instincts and move toward safe spaces quickly.

immediateSteps: Move to a room with two exits if possible.
Keep a charged phone and important documents nearby.
Send a pre-agreed code word to a trusted person.
whatNotToDo: Do not stay trapped in kitchens or balcony corners.
Do not delete threatening messages or call logs.
recommendedActions: Capture evidence safely and quietly.
Reach women helpline or local support center.
Leave and seek immediate shelter if violence escalates.

immediateSteps: Stay where you are and do not run far.
Find a police officer, shop staff, or a mother with kids.
Say your guardian phone number clearly.
whatNotToDo: Do not go with strangers.
Do not leave crowded safe areas.
recommendedActions: Call child helpline if guardian is unreachable.
Use fake call only if it helps draw safe attention.

immediateSteps: Change direction and enter a shop or public place.
Call someone and describe your location loudly.
Ask nearby people for visible help.
whatNotToDo: Do not go home directly.
Do not stop in isolated corners.
recommendedActions: Capture audio if safe.
Alert guardians with your live location.

immediateSteps: Create loud attention immediately.
Drop personal items in visible places to mark trail.
Send quick distress signal if phone is reachable.
whatNotToDo: Do not stay silent if people are nearby.
Do not unlock private information for unknown people.
recommendedActions: Prioritize escape to public lighted locations.
Trigger emergency readiness and stealth logs.

immediateSteps: Call emergency services and share exact location.
Check breathing and responsiveness.
Keep the person warm and calm until help arrives.
whatNotToDo: Do not give food or drink to unconscious person.
Do not move a person with possible spinal injury.
recommendedActions: Record incident timeline for responders.
Keep emergency numbers ready.

immediateSteps: Check responsiveness and call for emergency help.
Place hands at center of chest and compress 100-120/min.
After 30 compressions, give 2 rescue breaths if trained.
Continue until help arrives or breathing returns.
whatNotToDo: Do not stop CPR too early.
Do not delay calling emergency services.
recommendedActions: Use speaker mode while performing CPR.
Ask a bystander to rotate compressions every 2 minutes.

immediateSteps: Apply firm direct pressure on the wound.
Use clean cloth or gauze and keep pressure constant.
Raise injured area above heart level if possible.
whatNotToDo: Do not remove deeply embedded objects.
Do not keep checking wound repeatedly.
recommendedActions: Call emergency number quickly.
Watch for shock signs and keep patient warm.

immediateSteps: Move to medical and legal help immediately.
Preserve clothes, media files, and messages as evidence.
Write down timeline while details are fresh.
whatNotToDo: Do not delete recordings, photos, or call history.
Do not wash potential evidence items before guidance.
recommendedActions: Seek medical examination and mental health support.
Report incident with trusted support person present.
Back up evidence in secure storage.
